title: Go au natural at 63: Get a new hairdo & exfoliate hands
text: Share GET A NEW HAIRDO Until recently, I had long hair. I wasn’t nervous about getting it chopped off — I like to try different styles, whether it be a radical shape alteration or just changing my parting. I have naturally wavy hair, but like straightening it now and then for a sleeker look. The most important thing is to embrace change. EXFOLIATE YOUR HANDS It doesn't matter what else you do: as you get older, hands can be one of the most obvious giveaways of your age. Before anything else, I make time to exfoliate them with a moisturising scrub. Until recently, I had long hair. I wasn’t nervous about getting it chopped off — I like to try different styles, whether it be a radical shape alteration or just changing my parting It works wonders to smooth away the dead skin, keeping my hands silky soft and youthful. I also apply hand cream every day and have a professional manicure once a month. BRIGHT EYES I have always made an effort with my make-up and often used bold eye-shadows to brighten my blue eyes. As I’ve got older, however, I’m wary of coming across as if I’m trying too hard. A great trick is to blend brighter colours with neutral tones. I recommend using mineral eye-shadow as liner for a softer look and wearing lip liner to define lips and stop lipstick from bleeding. Do you look good for your age?
